labels.analysis: The MCP Server provides a comprehensive set of tools for managing and interacting with n8n workflows, projects, users, credentials, executions, and more. It enables secure integration between large language models and n8n workflow automation systems, allowing for direct management of workflows, credentials, and executions through a standardized protocol. The server facilitates workflow creation, modification, activation, and deletion, as well as user management and credential handling. This server is designed to streamline automation tasks by bridging LLM environments with n8n's capabilities.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Workflow Automation" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around managing, executing, and maintaining n8n workflows. The secondary labels "API Integration" and "Development Tools" were selected as the server provides extensive API operations for workflow automation and supports development-related workflow management. The custom label "n8n Management System" was created to specifically underscore the server's dedicated purpose of managing n8n workflows and related resources.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: n8n Workflow Integration Server
server_info_crawled.author: @tecnologiacomigo/n8n-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable Large Language Models to securely access and manage your n8n workflows, executions, credentials, and more through a standardized protocol. Streamline automation tasks by interacting with your n8n instance directly from your LLM environment. Simplify workflow management and execution with seamless integration.

tools.name: init-n8n
tools.description: Deploy Server n8n Workflow Integration Server @tecnologiacomigo/n8n-mcp-server Try in Playground

tools.name: list-workflows
tools.description: List all workflows from n8n. Use after init-n8n to see available workflows. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: get-workflow
tools.description: Retrieve a workflow by ID. Use after list-workflows to get detailed information about a specific workflow. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: create-workflow
tools.description: Create a new workflow in n8n. Use to set up a new workflow with optional nodes and connections. IMPORTANT: 1) Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines. 2) Must provide full workflow structure including nodes and connections arrays, even if empty. The 'active' property should not be included as it is read-only.

tools.name: update-workflow
tools.description: Update an existing workflow in n8n. Use after get-workflow to modify a workflow's properties, nodes, or connections. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: delete-workflow
tools.description: Delete a workflow by ID. This action cannot be undone. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: activate-workflow
tools.description: Activate a workflow by ID. This will enable the workflow to run. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: deactivate-workflow
tools.description: Deactivate a workflow by ID. This will prevent the workflow from running. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: list-projects
tools.description: List all projects from n8n. NOTE: Requires n8n Enterprise license with project management features enabled. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: create-project
tools.description: Create a new project in n8n. NOTE: Requires n8n Enterprise license with project management features enabled. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: delete-project
tools.description: Delete a project by ID. NOTE: Requires n8n Enterprise license with project management features enabled. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: update-project
tools.description: Update a project's name. NOTE: Requires n8n Enterprise license with project management features enabled. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: list-users
tools.description: Retrieve all users from your instance. Only available for the instance owner.

tools.name: create-users
tools.description: Create one or more users in your instance.

tools.name: get-user
tools.description: Get user by ID or email address.

tools.name: delete-user
tools.description: Delete a user from your instance.

tools.name: list-variables
tools.description: List all variables from n8n. NOTE: Requires n8n Enterprise license with variable management features enabled. Use after init-n8n to see available variables. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: create-variable
tools.description: Create a new variable in n8n. NOTE: Requires n8n Enterprise license with variable management features enabled. Variables can be used across workflows to store and share data. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: delete-variable
tools.description: Delete a variable by ID. NOTE: Requires n8n Enterprise license with variable management features enabled. Use after list-variables to get the ID of the variable to delete. This action cannot be undone. IMPORTANT: Arguments must be provided as compact, single-line JSON without whitespace or newlines.

tools.name: create-credential
tools.description: Create a credential that can be used by nodes of the specified type. The credential type name can be found in the n8n UI when creating credentials (e.g., 'cloudflareApi', 'githubApi', 'slackOAuth2Api'). Use get-credential-schema first to see what fields are required for the credential type you want to create.

tools.name: delete-credential
tools.description: Delete a credential by ID. You must be the owner of the credentials.

tools.name: get-credential-schema
tools.description: Show credential data schema for a specific credential type. The credential type name can be found in the n8n UI when creating credentials (e.g., 'cloudflareApi', 'githubApi', 'slackOAuth2Api'). This will show you what fields are required for creating credentials of this type.

tools.name: list-executions
tools.description: Retrieve all executions from your instance with optional filtering.

tools.name: get-execution
tools.description: Retrieve a specific execution by ID.

tools.name: delete-execution
tools.description: Delete a specific execution by ID.

tools.name: create-tag
tools.description: Create a new tag in your instance.

tools.name: list-tags
tools.description: Retrieve all tags from your instance.

tools.name: get-tag
tools.description: Retrieve a specific tag by ID.

tools.name: update-tag
tools.description: Description not available

tools.name: delete-tag
tools.description: Description not available

tools.name: get-workflow-tags
tools.description: Get tags associated with a workflow.

tools.name: update-workflow-tags
tools.description: Update tags associated with a workflow.

tools.name: generate-audit
tools.description: Generate a security audit for your n8n instance.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@tecnologiacomigo/n8n-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
